tool_description: Various Data Extraction and NLP functions. Some are English centric but can be extended to other languages upon custom request.
name: NLP
title: NLP

api_list.name: Sentiment
api_list.description: Provides sentiment for submitted sentences, one sentence per line.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://nlp3.p.rapidapi.com/sentiment"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "nlp3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://nlp3.p.rapidapi.com/sentiment"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "nlp3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Text Summarization
api_list.description: Summarizes a text with paraphrasing. It extracts the essential information and removes redundancies.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://nlp3.p.rapidapi.com/summarize"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "nlp3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Extract Main Content From HTML
api_list.description: Removes boilerplate: navigations, sidebars, ads, footer, etc.. Works on different types of pages.

api_list.name: Extract Structured Data From URL or HTML text
api_list.description: Detects flavors of Schema.org markup and extracts into single JSON. Combined simplified data shown as well.

api_list.name: People Also Ask
api_list.description: Find questions people ask relevant to your search. Also, find some answer examples and answer to question mapping statistics.

url = "https://nlp3.p.rapidapi.com/people-also-ask"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "nlp3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
